intro: Tigridia conchiflora, commonly known as the Mexican hat flower, is a species of flowering plant in the Amaryllidaceae family. It is native to Mexico and is characterized by its striking, helmet-shaped flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant produces showy, tubular blooms that attract pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds. It has strap-like, grassy leaves and is often grown as an ornamental plant in gardens. Tigridia conchiflora is relatively drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soil.
